channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge declines to restrict DOGE's access to Labor Department systems
item.description: Six labor unions and the Economic Policy Institute had asked the court to restrict DOGE's access to Labor Department systems.

item.title: Sonya Massey's family reaches $10 million settlement with Sangamon County
item.description: Massey was shot and killed in her home near Springfield last July. Former Sangamon County Sheriff's deputy Sean Grayson is charged with her murder.

item.title: 16 things Trump and his team did this week
item.description: In his third week back in office, Trump took action on issues from transgender competitors in women's sports to Gaza.

item.title: Trump fires archivist of the United States
item.description: President Trump has fired the nation's top record keeper, Archivist of the United States Colleen J. Shogan.

item.title: How conspiracy theories about Politico led Trump to cancel subscriptions
item.description: Less than 24 hours after misleading claims started circulating that tied Politico to USAID, the White House vowed to end subscriptions for the insider...

item.title: Trump orders U.S. to prioritize refugee resettlement of White Afrikaners
item.description: President Trump directed officials to prioritize the resettlement of Afrikaners in South Africa through the U.S. refugee program, which he suspended o...

item.title: Trump says he is revoking Biden's security clearance
item.description: "There is no need for Joe Biden to continue receiving access to classified information," President Donald Trump says.

item.title: Baltic states making historic switch away from Russian power grid
item.description: More than 30 years after leaving the Soviet Union, Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania will join the EU's grid.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump plan to put thousands of USAID staff on leave
item.description: A last-minute lawsuit means Trump's efforts to dismantle the overseas aid agency have been put on hold.

item.title: Modi's BJP ahead in tightly-fought Delhi election race
item.description: Early trends show Modi's party is ahead of the incumbent Aam Aadmi Party as votes are counted in India's capital.

item.title: Passport applications got more complicated for transgender Americans under new Trump policy
Generations later, a remedy to destroying Black neighborhoods is fulfilled in Michigan
Morale plummets at the CDC as staff fear job losses
item.description: Staff at the CDC are bracing for a significant reduction in the work force that appears to be targeting staff with the fewest worker protections.

item.title: Crews rush to recover commuter plane found crashed on Alaska sea ice before expected snow and wind
item.description: Just hours after finding 10 people dead in western Alaska from one of the deadliest plane crashes in the state in 25 years, authorities are racing to ...

item.title: 19 states sue to stop DOGE from accessing Americans' personal data
item.description: The case, filed in federal court in New York City, alleges the Trump administration allowed Musk's team access to the Treasury Department's central pa...

item.title: Trump to fire multiple Kennedy Center board members, name himself chair
item.description: President Trump did not say which board members at the Kennedy Center he plans to terminate.

item.title: Trump plans to name himself chair of Kennedy Center, fire board members
item.description: The president announced Friday that he would remove multiple board members, including the Chairman, who do not share his vision for a "Golden Age in A...

item.title: Musk's team takes control of key systems at Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
item.description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is the latest target of Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency.
